text.text_translated:
Asteroids are small rocks in space.
Some asteroids are called 'PHAs'.
These PHAs can be dangerous.
They come very close to Earth.
They pass less than 7.5 million kilometres from Earth's path.
NASA has a map of 1,400 PHAs.
None of them are a danger for the next 100 years.
NASA has special technology.
NASA tracks these PHAs.
They can predict if a PHA will hit Earth.
They can also say when.
If a PHA might hit, NASA has two ways to protect Earth.
They can send special things to space to stop it.
